Transcript: Jack: What the --
Jamal: Somebody taped over Zach's confession.
Alison: Yeah, I know. We heard.

Jamal: No, the original copy -- the one that I had dubbed and sent to Zach. 
The one of him admitting that he's been fixing these races and threatening you.
Alison: Ok, Jamal, I know that you're upset, but you need to calm down.
Jamal: Ali, Ali, how could you have done this?
Alison: Whoa! No! Me? No! No, not with that song, I didn't.
Jack: Well, if you didn't do it, who did it?
Livvie: Ah, hey, guys, I think it might have been me.

Ian's Voice: I want us to have a life together, someplace where -- it would 
fill our souls. With tiny, little rugrats that look like you running around. 
Could you stand it, Lambert? A whole lifetime of our kind of mayhem?
Eve: You take my breath away.

Ian: Every word is true. I want us to grow old together and still love each 
other. And we will. I know it.

Kevin: Rhonda? How you feeling? Don't feel like talking, huh? That's all 
right, I can do the talking. I know Dr. Scanlon spoke to you about your medical 
condition -- the toll that all the years of drinking has taken on your body. I 
also know that you were a match for a liver transplant for someone. But your own 
is so damaged --

Rhonda: If you're here to tell me I'm drinking myself to death, I already 
know that.
Kevin: Doesn't that bother you?
Rhonda: Why should it? What do I have to live for?
Frank: Hey, hey, hey. Here you go, buddy.
Mary: Frankie! Frankie Scanlon, you come back here.
Jamal: You taped a song over the confession I got from Zach?
Alison: Livvie, why would you do something like that?
Livvie: Look, I didn't mean to.
Jack: Sweetie, how'd it happen?

Livvie: Well, remember the other night when Alison and I planned that little 
dinner party for you guys?
Jamal: Yeah.

Livvie: Well, we wanted to listen to different music, and I didn't have time 
to go out and buy CDs, so I decided to just, you know, tape some stuff off of 
the radio.
Jamal: Oh, man.

Livvie: And the cassette was just sitting there with all these blank tapes 
and there wasn't anything marked on it, so I just -- I just figured --
Alison: But, Livvie, didn't you check to, like, make sure, you know?
Jamal: Or to ask somebody before you go taping over somebody's stuff?
Livvie: Look, I'm sorry.
Jamal: Well, yeah, a lot of good that's going to do us now.

Jack: All right. Hey, hey, hey. All right? It was an accident. All right, 
what's done is done.

Livvie: You know, they're right. This is all my fault. I should have made 
sure.

Jamal: No, you know what? No, Jack's right. I mean, you didn't mean any harm, 
so -- whatever.
Alison: Yeah, Livvie, um, you know, we'll find another way somehow.

Livvie: How? Zach's confession is gone, which means -- I don't even want to 
think about what that means.
[Knock on door]
Jamal: Well, I think we're going to find out right now.

Zach: Thanks for the tape, bro, but I got to tell you, it's not really my

Sam: Yeah, he's more Christina Aguilera.
Jamal: That was a mistake.
Zach: Yeah, big one.

Ian's Voice: I saw it from the first moment I met you. And I know it now. 
It's fate or destiny or whatever you want to call it. We need to live this out, 
Eve.
Eve: How can you be so sure?
Ian: After everything we've been through, how can you not be?
Arianna's Voice: My place is with my husband now. We were married today.
Eve: Arianna needs you. You are her strength. You are her will to live.
Chris: You're going to be a mom. Congratulations.

Eve: He's taking Arianna home, probably to die if she doesn't get a donor 
soon. The last thing Ian needs to know is that I'm pregnant.

Chris: You said that you were ready to pack up and leave Port Charles before 
anybody found out you were expecting. Eve, we could do that together. Find a 
little town where it's great to raise kids, start our own practice, make a whole 
new life for ourselves.
Eve: But we're not in love, Chris.

Chris: I know you love Ian. I'm not asking you to stop. All I want is a shot 
at a family. I mean, you know, the kind that neither of us ever had. I'd be a 
great father. I guarantee it.

Mary: Honey, didn't you hear Mommy calling you? You're supposed to stay

Frank: No. Here you go. Did you say his name is Frankie?

Mary: Well, it's short for Francis -- Francis Xavier Scanlon -- but we call

Frank: No, it's just -- my name is Frank, too.
Mary: Really?
Frank: You're having another baby.

Mary: So they tell me. Well, as I said, I'm sorry if he bothered you, but

Frank: I'm sure he's just having fun.
Mary: Ok. Wave bye-bye to the nice man. Bye. Say bye.
Frank: Bye.
Mary: Bye. Bye-bye.
Frank: Wait, Mom.

Zach: Nah. Nah. Of course not.

Sam: Excuse me?

Sam: Relax, honey. I'm just being friendly.

Zach: What I've always wanted, bro.
Alison: You got it. He raced.
Jamal: Yeah, and you swore that was the last one.

Zach: This race coming up, it's the last time I'll need you. And I mean it

Jamal: All right. Sure you do.

Zach: Bottom line here -- do this, we all reap the reward. Don't? Who knows

Alison: Look, you so don't threaten him, and you don't threaten me, either.
Zach: Last chance, man. What's it going to be?
Jamal: I'll do it.

Kevin: Yeah, Colleen. I'll need you to clear the rest of my day. All right, 
thank you.
Deneice: Well, looking a little better.

Rhonda: Can I get out of this dump, then? The food stinks, the service is

Deneice: Yeah, I keep telling them the place hasn't been the same since they

Kevin: Rhonda --

Rhonda: I don't have anything to say, so if you've rearranged your schedule

Rhonda: I don't need a shrink.

Kevin: You said you had nothing to live for. Those are words I don't take

Rhonda: There was someone a long time ago, but I lost that.
Kevin: Maybe if you try you can get it back.

Rhonda: Now my life's empty. It has been for years. These last few weeks have

Kevin: You mean with what's been going on with Frank Scanlon.

Rhonda: Why does he keep on saying I have a daughter? It's just a big, cruel

Kevin: No, I believe Frank's convinced it's true.
Rhonda: That's crazy.
Kevin: So there's no possible way?

Rhonda: Listen, I know with my drinking, you know, sometimes I forget things,

Kevin: Rhonda, what about some of the other things Frank's been saying, like

Rhonda: I don't want to talk about that.

Kevin: But can you tell me if you ever recall communicating with someone on

Rhonda: I said I don't want to talk about it. That computer has done nothing

Mary: Did you call me Mom?

Frank: Actually, I did, because I don't know your name, only that you're

Mary: Oh, no, that's ok. My name is Mary.
Frank: Frank.

Frank: You already know that.
Mary: Did you want to ask me something?
Frank: Only about a million things. I mean, I'm new here to Port Charles.

Frank: You know, if it's not too much to ask, would you mind grabbing a latte

Mary: A latte?
Frank: I mean coffee.

Frank: Right. Well, they're very popular where I'm from.
Mary: And where's that, exactly?
Frank: You wouldn't believe it if I told you.
Mary: Oh, now I'm really curious.
Frank: Well, then, how about that lat-- coffee.

Frank: Oh. Hey, I understand.

Mary: But you know what? I don't think it would matter if I was a little bit

Frank: No, you couldn't put that off, not because of me.
Mary: Well, an hour either way, I don't think it'd matter.

Mary: Ok. Before I leave, do you need any directions or anything?
